"opts_" Callback based command line options handler

This API wraps the getopt_long functionality and provides a general call back mechanism to define the behavior of command line flags. More...

 output the usage message and exit

Detailed Description

This API wraps the getopt_long functionality and provides a general call back mechanism to define the behavior of command line flags.

TO USE:

  • opts_init() to initialize the subsystem
  • opts_default_opts() to add useful default opts (help and version)
  • Define the arguments using:
    • opts_def()
    • OPTS_DEF
    • OPTS_DEF_ARG,
    • OPTS_DEF_CLEAR
    • OPTS_DEF_INCR
    • OPTS_DEF_SET
    • OPTS_DEF_STRTOL
  • opts_getopt() parses the known options
    • -1 end of options (no error)
    • Anything else, and unknown flag either
      • catch in a traditional getopts switch such as 
               while ((c = opts_getopt (argc, argv)) != -1) {
               switch (c) {
               // add stuff opts_getopt() can't handle
               case 'Z':
                       Z_option_handler();
                       break;
               // end of stuff opts_utils can't handle 
               default:
                       opts_usage();
               }
       }
      • opts_usage() to display usage message and exit.
TODO
  • Add optional argument support
  • Allow use of non-printable shortnames for longname only options

Function Documentation

void opts_def (  char    short_name,
char *    long_name,
char *    description,
char *    arg_name,
T_opts_action    action,
void *    data
) 
 

add the given option to the opts_table

Parameters:
short_name  the 1 character that uniquely identifies this option
long_name  the long (no spaces) name for this option. Must be non-NULL.
description  descriptive text for this option. If arg_name is non-NULL, %s in description will insert arg_name.
arg_name  the descriptive name of the argument the option takes (if an option takes an argument), or NULL if it doesn't.
action  the callback action if the flag is found
data  pointer to the data the callback will need.

int opts_getopt (  int    argc,
char *const *    argv
) 
 

parse the known options, calling their callback actions, and returning on unknown options with the identical semantics of getopt

Parameters:
argc  the argument count
argv  the argument array
Returns:
-1 for end of arguments, anything else for an unknown options

void opts_init (  const char *    progname,
const char *    progversion
) 
 

initialize the "opts_" Callback based command line options handler subsystem. Call this before calling

Returns:
0 for success non-zero for failure
